title: FF never visits sites although other browsers do
content:
To Whom,

I am an enthusiastic user of Firefox (89.0 64 bit) under Windows 10 Pro 20H2.

Yesterday, I installed Microsoft Visual Studio 2019 (Community edition) on my PC and FF stopped working. At subsequent startup, FF showed a "New Tab" -- blank -- instead of my Homepage. "New Tab" never changes.

I switched to the Microsoft "Edge" browser, which allowed me to import my "Bookmarks" (created in FF), and offered me a working link to Mozilla Help. "Edge" works fine in every respect.

Mozilla "Support" steered me to an article about changing what was displayed on the "New Tab" -- "Change your New Tab page content" -- but the "Personalize" button wasn't anywhere to be found, so it didn't help me.

And the "Settings" item was where it should be on the hamburger menu, but picking the item just returned to the "New Tab"

By picking from a list of recent links dropped-down from the address box in FF, I was able to put an assortment of candidate links into the address box, but not to "Visit" any of them. The Tab stayed stubbornly "New". It seemed to me that most things were as expected up to that point. But a browser that won't navigate is a sad thing.

I'm doing OK with "Edge" + my bookmarks, but I am anxious to get back to FF. What should I do?

Sincerely,

Al Bondiga
creator: jlewontin

title: Firefox 84.0 Opens Extra Window when Launched via Hyperlink on macOS
content:
I'm on an iMac running Big Sur 11.4 and Firefox 84.0. When I click on an external hyperlink (say from an email), a new Firefox window opens to my home page even though there is already a Firefox window open. There is only one tab in the new Firefox window (not two like previously reported) - the home page. This does not happen when I switch to Safari. In preferences, I have "open links in tabs instead of new windows" checked. This just started a few months ago. Also, in the example email, when i hover over the hyperlink, a little downarrow box appears to the right of the link. When I click on the down arrow, a window opens with the proper link, but it's not a Firefox window. At the top of this new window, there is a box that says "open with Safari". When I click on it, it takes me to a new Firefox window with only the home page tab. ????

Bob

creator: giuseppe.begni

title: It's a sad day... saying goodbye to Firefox
content:
I've been on Firefox for 15 years, I suppose - it's really the only browser I've used. I've seen the product go steadily downhill, but I've stuck with it - because (until last week) Firefox had the best support for people with visual disabilities - like myself.

But 89 is the last straw. The new UX, the new setup for tabs is simply unusable for me - and I suspect for many with visual impairment. I can't even see the tabs distinctly.

It's a bloody shame. Firefox was a great product. Firefox - 20 or so versions ago - was better than anything else out there. But now.

It's unusable for me - and I'm sure many others.

I'm not saying this to gripe. I'm saying this so that, hopefully someone in Mozilla will change the strategy of a new release every ten days, and go back to a stable, usable, secure browser.

But it's a sad day.

title: Firefox won't open urldefense email links
content:
My employer uses Proofpoint's urldefense to protect against malicious links in Outlook emails. A problem I'm having while working from home on my own Windows PC is that, with Firefox as my default browser, certain links that I know to be safe won't open. If, however, I change my default browser to, for example, Brave, they do open in Brave. My less than satisfactory work-around is to have Brave as my default browser while using Firefox whenever I can.

Insofar as I understand Proofpoint's explanation of how urldefense works, it rewrites links within Outlook emails so that clicking on a link goes to their facility for checking whether the original url is on their safe list. But if this indeed is how urldefense works, I don't understand how certain links "pass" and are opened in Brave but "fail" and do not open in Firefox.

It's an admittedly minor inconvenience. Nevertheless, if anyone knows of a fix, I'd be grateful.

Thank you in advance for your consideration.
creator: david.guberman

title: this is a thank you follow-up to my yesterdays' post starting with; "firefox version 89...
content: This is a thank you follow-up to my yesterdays' post starting with; "firefox version 89 is insanely slow with no explanation had to try reset...." I can't find my msg from yesterday started with this, but wanted to thank you all for fixing Everything - Overnight! I am So glad I waited to, "system restore," until today bec it(MSs' OS) gave warning it might not restore All of the elements correctly. Thank you for your hard work and just appreciating how essential the browsers' Working is to our lives. It is. Thank you, thank you, thank you!  :) (I'm now thinking I should maybe put my updates on "notify me first /let me download when ready"...but I'm not really sure if that would accomplish anything because I'd still have to download them to see if there were problem/s that effected My devise in particular. Community posts don't tell you that - or what to do. Pop-up status msgs would be appreciated.. if you'd have time...even if not all knowing...just to know some are aware of X issue...working on it...estimated back up time... whether we could/should do a "system restore" & wait until further notice to DL again. But I guess our issues are what you need to see to fix them...But I digress. Thank you again for working hard to store functionality. I needed something right to happen in my life - someone to be an expert at what they do. Thanks for your humanity.

title: Weird behaviours on Firefox
content:
Hey!

I'm new to Firefox and I gotta say: it is the prettiest browser out there!

But there are some things that are trully bothering me and would like to know if it is normal. I would like love to keep using Firefox because of its beauty, but with those things I don't think I'll be able to.

Here are the things: * Performance on Firefox is bad if compared to Opera GX or Edge. Yes, I did enable the hardware acceleration but still... scrolling down on Facebook is choppy (don't know if it is an appropriate word, but still), opening and trying to move the screen on Roll20 (virtual tabletop) and some more... Any clues?

* Websites are not the same Sometimes I see a website with different styles that I was used to see on Opera GX and Edge. Trello scrollbars is an example of that. title: Firefox 89: Will not remember window size and location.
content:
Since upgrading to v89 I have found that FF will now refuse to remember its last used window size and location, and FF v88 didn't exhibit the same issue.

I will preface this by saying I fully appreciate Windows 10 20h2 is probably partly to blame. I use a ultrawide monitor (3440*1440) and windows10 itself has an utterly crap window size and location issue(since v1809 upto 20H2) with most applications/programs. So to get around that I have been using Windowmanager (http://www.desksoft.com/WindowManager.htm) and/or Ultramon (https://www.realtimesoft.com/ultramon/) to brute force Window pos/size etc.

Every application/program that I have created a profile for with the size/location info works perfectly and so did FF v88. But FF v89 is refusing point blank to be told where I want it. Even doing a refresh of FF by nuking the profile folder from (C:\Users\<user name>\AppData\Roaming\Mozilla\Firefox\Profiles) will not resolve the behavior.

The only 'sorta' workaround from my side is to run the monitor in dual-screen mode (2x 1720*1440), and at this point FF v89 will only behave itself for the first launch of the browser. If I launch additional FF v89 windows, the same bloody off to the right and up behavior is back.

And secondly even setting the shortcut to always launch FF v89 as maximized does not work, FF v89 again refuses to behave and does wtf it wants to do.

So if resetting FF completely does not fix the issue, this suggests an issue with FF v89 or a comparability issue between it and Windows 10 20h2

content:
The problem relates to certain operations in the TradingView site [ https://www.tradingview.com ].

Specifically, it is not possible to copy an existing "chart layout" or create a new "chart layout". The browser returns nothing and displays the following messages in the console window:

11:57:42.631 Firefox can’t establish a connection to the server at wss://pushstream.tradingview.com/message-pipe-ws/public. category.3da3001df2015bf02b60.js:148:2852

11:57:42.631 Firefox can’t establish a connection to the server at wss://pushstream.tradingview.com/message-pipe-ws/private_7R9Lt0ZDacFGtwoNYSCYHiKJAeWGIiIeoHhqnqiq0VA. category.3da3001df2015bf02b60.js:148:2852

11:57:42.639 The connection to wss://pushstream.tradingview.com/message-pipe-ws/public was interrupted while the page was loading. category.3da3001df2015bf02b60.js:148:2852

11:57:42.639 The connection to wss://pushstream.tradingview.com/message-pipe-ws/private_7R9Lt0ZDacFGtwoNYSCYHiKJAeWGIiIeoHhqnqiq0VA was interrupted while the page was loading. category.3da3001df2015bf02b60.js:148:2852

11:58:03.260 Content Security Policy: Ignoring “'unsafe-inline'” within script-src or style-src: nonce-source or hash-source specified

The TradingView technical team insists that the problem is due to Firefox. In fact, everything works fine when using Chrome or Vivaldi.

Any suggestions? Thanks.
creator: g.tzatzopoulos

title: After syncing bookmarks, how to show local folders above remote folders?
content:
When I sync bookmarks, I get a copy of all bookmarks on both my android and my desktop. They are separated with each in their own folder: "mobile bookmarks" and "desktop bookmarks". So far so good.

But: the desktop folder always seems to show at the top. On my phone, I don't usually want to interact with those bookmarks, so I have to scroll past them. When adding or loading a bookmark, I just have to scroll past the top level entry, but it I want to edit the folder a bookmark is in, all folders are expanded, so I have to scroll past every subfolder on my desktop.

I think there could be at least four potential solutions for this, but everything I've found says that none of them work. 1. Default local folders to the top 2. Allow reordering of folders on Android Firefox 3. Allow minimising folders in the "edit bookmark" interface. (Or start with all folders minimised except the current path.) 4. Allow syncing in one direction only. (I don't actually need my desktop bookmarks on my phone, but I do want my phone bookmarks on my desktop.)

title: System Theme [FIXED]
content: I had previously set ui.systemUsesDarkTheme = 0 to make internal pages light. Apparently, this preference has been removed in the current update and continuing to use it directly reflects on the System Theme extension. Simply select the "Trash Can" and remove it. Hope this helps.

title: Right-Click Select All Does Not Work In Firefox 89

creator: soofeenee2

title: Cannot manually visit HTTP websites - complete automatic redirect to HTTPS
content:
For a few days now, Firefox (Dev. Edition, version 90) has not allowed me to manually visit http:// websites, and automatically and silently redirects to their https:// version. This is on every single website I have tried.

Things that I have tried:

Disable/remove HTTPS Everywhere Enable then re-disable built-in Firefox HTTPS Only Mode

Restart Firefox 'Forget about this site' Clear cache Clear site preferences A bunch of stuff in about:config (fallback-to-https, stricttransportpreloadlist etc)
creator: ajfigurelli

title: New June 1 firefox version resulted in sound quality affected - now tinny, distorted
content: All of a sudden after firefox installed new version June 1, the sound quality is distorted, tinny, like out of an old AM radio. Especially noticed on youtube rock videos, which sound terrible. How can I get the great sound quality back that I had before this "improvement"?

title: Where is button in address bar? Firefox 89

title: Firefox crashes when I open Netflix or Amazon Prime Video
content:
I have an older PC but it was working fine with Netflix and Prime Video until this latest update (v89.0). It seems that when I try to go to Netflix or Amazon Prime Video the browser crashes almost instantly, and usually shuts my whole computer off. It doesn't go to a blue screen, the computer just decides it's time to reboot. Now again, I'm using an older machine (and I can't afford a new one), but this was never a problem until this latest version of Firefox.

I am also not a fan of the aesthetics in this version and I'm wondering if I can revert back to an older version where the crashing was less frequent. Any help would be appreciated.
creator: do.not.email.me
